This is actually due to Decorations (SWT) disposing the widget not decorators 
and is in the shutdown for Text.

Moving to component owner.
*** Bug 40354 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

How were you shutting down the workbench?

By the time Workbench.run calls Device(Display).dispose(), the windows should
already have been closed (in busyClose).
I am exiting through File menu>Exit.

Still occurs in 20030717, I have line numbers now...

Fixed in HEAD.
Must fix for I20030717-rebuild.
*** Bug 40307 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I'm still puzzled by this stack.  The one from Jerome in bug 40307 goes through 
QuitAction (File / Exit) but Philippe's does not - the shell is being disposed 
in Display.dispose(), but it should not have made it this far.
I'm investigating, but if you know of any other differences in your setup, 
please provide details.

They are both triggered by a follow up to bug 40319. You can also see that they
are related by the Jeromes bug: in the summary he writes NPE but then he
attached an AssertionFailedException stack.

In my stack trace (Bug 40354) I am using multiple windows, I exited via File -
> exit, and I also had encountered "ctrl-s not working", bug 40303, although 
perhaps it is unrelated.

The stack trace is result of an inconsistent state when closing an editor 
caused by a previous exception you don't always see in the log. It does not 
matter how you close the editor. See Bug #40319.

test case:
open two windows, open same file in both editors, close the editor in one window
then in the other.

verified in I20030717-rebuild
